Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Instantly \In"stant*ly\, adv. 1. Without the least delay or interval; at once; immediately. --Macaulay. [1913 Webster]
2. With urgency or importunity; earnestly; pressingly. ``They besought him instantly.'' --Luke vii. 4.
Syn: Directly; immediately; at once. See {Directly}. [1913 Webster]

instantly adv 1: without delay or hesitation; with no time intervening; "he answered immediately"; "found an answer straightaway"; "an official accused of dishonesty should be suspended forthwith"; "Come here now!" [syn: {immediately}, {straightaway}, {straight off}, {directly}, {now}, {right away}, {at once}, {forthwith}, {in real time}, {like a shot}] 2: without any delay; "he was killed outright" [syn: {instantaneously}, {outright}, {in a flash}]
